questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the components from the left into the order on the right to create the flow of the three-legged OAuth2.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Sure, here is the order for the three-legged OAuth2 flow using the three options you provided:

Application: Sends an authorization request to the user, requesting access to the API.
User: Provides consent to the application by authenticating with the authorization server.
API: Issues an access token to the application after receiving the authenticated user's consent.
I wish all the questions were like this lol

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

questions.question_text:
A development team is looking for a tool to automate configurations across the infrastructure. The tool must have these characteristics:
• written in Python
• define playbooks for intent
• stateless
• imperative

Which tool meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A,D - out of discussion
C - is not enforcing any VCS (eq. you could do a wget to ret the code from a zip file)

Selected Answer: D
I am not sure... For CI/CD pipeline correct answer exact B.
enables a faster feedback loop = Accelerated feedback loop: CI/CD pipelines provide rapid feedback on code changes, allowing developers to quickly identify and rectify issues, resulting in faster software iteration.
But it may be tricky question about CI pipeline - what is only part of CI/CD proccess included Build, Test, Merge... So Answer can be D. A- Incorrect, B, C - incorrect because there are benefits for whole CI/CD proccess

I am not sure... For CI/CD pipeline correct answer exact B.
enables a faster feedback loop = Accelerated feedback loop: CI/CD pipelines provide rapid feedback on code changes, allowing developers to quickly identify and rectify issues, resulting in faster software iteration.
But it may be tricky question about CI pipeline - what is only part of CI/CD proccess included Build, Test, Merge... So Answer can be D. A- Incorrect, B, C - incorrect becouse there are benefits for whole CI/CD proccess

Selected Answer: B
i think it's B. with ci/cd pipeline you can detect bug because pushing the change in prod. for version control, it's git. so i will go with B

comments.content: Even though C is a benefit of the CI pipeline, according to ChatGPT, the main benefit is B, enabling a faster feedback loop. I might go with that if I get the question in the exam.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct: https://blogs.cisco.com/developer/gitlabcicdpipelines01

choices.D: ensures that tests are written before code is written
